result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph W Thornton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Assessments/restitution entered.

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  On Motion of the State,  Court ordered case DISMISSED.

Restitution payable to STATE FARM INSURANCE in the amount of FIVE THOUSAND THREE HUNDRED TWENTY-EIGHT DOLLARS AND EIGHTY-TWO CENTS ($5,328.82) to be converted to a Civil Judgment FORTHWITH WITHOUT tax intercept.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has completed all terms of the DPA except for Restitution.  Defense advised that Defendant has provided Money Orders that are less than FORTY DOLLARS ($40.00) away from the agreed upon amount of ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($100.00).  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Defense is in TRIAL.  Matter is ADJOURNED to 04-26-2016 at 01:30 pm.  sdg
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  COURT VACATED THE STAYED WARRANT FROM THE PREVIOUS DATE.  Defense advised that the Defendant had mixed up the last Court date,  however Defendant IS in contact with his Attorney as best as he is able.  Defense advised that Defendant has thus far tendered FIFTY-FIVE DOLLARS ($55.00) towards the full TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS ($200.00) agreed upon in the DPA.  State advised that Defendant NEEDS to keep his appointments with JusticePoint or there may be a Warrant issued.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant acknowledged he is aware that he needs to meet with JusticePoint.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense does not have an explanation as to the Defendant's whereabouts.  State does not object to a STAYED Bench Warrant.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.

  Review hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court VACATES Bench Warrant STAYED at the last Hearing date.  Court CANCELS Drug testing by JusticePoint.  Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense is unaware of Defendant's whereabouts.  Court ISSUES and STAYS Bench Warrant.  Matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report dated 10-19-2015.  Filed, sdg.
JUSTICE POINT REPORT, FILED

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Court VACATES stayed Warrant issued 09-01-2015.  Defense will refer Defendant to Client Services to assist with communications regarding monitoring.  Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement report, received and filed.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Case is adjourned for DPA in br. 6.

Defendant Joseph W Thornton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 6/15/15 @ 8:30AM
